### Windows

1. Download `miniforge` package manager from [Github](https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge#download) for your operating system.
2. Execute the installer and make sure to create start menu shortcuts (there's a tick box during installation).
3. Open the installed `Miniforge Prompt` application.
4. Create a Python environment using the following command:

```sh
mamba env create -f https://martinfleischmann.net/sds/environment.yml
```

5. Activate the environment using:

```sh
mamba activate sds
```

6. Start JupyterLab interface:

```sh
jupyter lab
```

### macOS & Linux

1. Download `miniforge` package manager from [Github](https://github.com/conda-forge/miniforge#download) for your operating system and install it.
3. Open `Terminal` application.
4. Create a Python environment using the following command:

```sh
mamba env create -f https://martinfleischmann.net/sds/environment.yml
```

5. Activate the environment using:

```sh
mamba activate sds
```

6. Start JupyterLab interface:

```sh
jupyter lab
```
:::
